poem:
The Chamber's Echo

In Washington's marble hall,
feet stamp like distant thunder.
Netanyahu seeks a name
in the din of democracy,
while voices murmur ceasefire
and the whispered wish for peace
floats like a fragile kite,
tethered to hope,
dancing against
an ever-stormy sky.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Netanyahu to meet Biden and Harris amid hope for progress on ceasefire and hostages 9.06am BST On his third day in Washington, Benjamin Netanyahu finally got the attention he so desperately wanted in the US capital. Republicans and their guests in the House chamber stamped their feet and whistled as a joint session was gaveled into order, while the Democrat lawmakers who chose not to boycott someone whom colleagues had called a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
